greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 1 if there are no odd runs of 1's in the binary expansion of n followed by a 0 to their right, 0 otherwise.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..65537
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
formula: a(0) = 1; and then after, for odd n, a(n) = a((n-1)/2), for even n, a(n) = 0 if A007814(1+(n/2)) is odd, otherwise a(n/2).
example: Drawing the terms as a binary tree (the first six levels shown) helps in seeing where terms of A028982 (squares and twice squares) are located in Doudna-tree (A005940, at the positions where 1's occur here):
mathematica: Array[Boole@ NoneTrue[Partition[PadRight[#, # + Boole[OddQ@ #] &@ Length@ #, ""] /. _?StringQ -> {0, 0}, 2, 2][[All, All, -1]] &@ Map[{First@ #, Length@ #} &, Split@ IntegerDigits[#, 2]], And[OddQ@ #1, #2 > 0] & @@ # &] &, 120, 0] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Dec 02 2017 *)
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 01 2017
